issue.title: Final Competition Worlds Quite Different from Test Worlds?

content.raw:
I'm not sure what you mean that one of the options is to do the tasks separately. The rules state:

*A competition run consists of all three tasks performed in succession. Teams are required to complete five competition runs during the finals. A team may optionally skip checkpoints within a task in order to advance through a competition run.*

You can skip straight to Task 2 if you want, but then you'll get no points for Task 1. That happens inside a world which has all 3 tasks.

The single task worlds provided with the software are meant only to aid in practice.

I'm not sure what you mean that one of the options is to do the tasks separately. The rules state:

A competition run consists of all three tasks performed in succession. Teams are required to complete five competition runs during the finals. A team may optionally skip checkpoints within a task in order to advance through a competition run.

You can skip straight to Task 2 if you want, but then you'll get no points for Task 1. That happens inside a world which has all 3 tasks.

The single task worlds provided with the software are meant only to aid in practice.
